text: James Pierce Jr. House, also known as Piercestead, is a historic home located in Wabash Township, Tippecanoe County, Indiana. It was built in 1833–1834, and is a two-story, Greek Revival style brick dwelling, with a one-story rear ell and one-story wing. It is four bays wide and has a slate gable roof. It also housed the Cass Post Office between 1846 and 1855. Note: This includes It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Greek Revival houses in Indiana Category:Houses completed in 1834 Category:Houses in Tippecanoe County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Tippecanoe County, Indiana
title: James Pierce Jr. House
